meanings.definition: Music consisting of a single melodic line without accompaniment.
meanings.sent1: The choir sang in monophony, with only one clear melody.
meanings.sent2: In monophony, there is only one main tune playing.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to chirp in monophony, as if following a secret conductor.
meanings.sent4: The sound of raindrops hitting the roof created a monophony of nature's music.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of monophony allows the melody to shine brightly.

meanings.definition: A musical texture in which a single melodic line is heard without accompaniment.
meanings.sent1: The flute solo showcased the beauty of monophony in music.
meanings.sent2: Listening to a monophony piece can be quite soothing.
meanings.sent3: The lonely violin played a monophony that echoed through the empty hall.
meanings.sent4: Her voice soared in a monophony that touched the hearts of all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The purity of the monophony highlighted the skill of the soloist.
